channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 frontliners honored as 'modern-day heroes' on National Heroes Day
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: On National Heroes’ Day, the country does not only honor those who fought for the nation’s freedom but also the heroism of the people “who risk their lives fighting a different kind of enemy,” President Rodrigo Duterte said.

item.title: LIVE updates: COVID-19 and extended quarantine in the Philippines
item.author: PhilstarLIVE
item.description: The latest updates on the spread of the novel coronavirus in the Philippines and enhanced community quarantine of economic center of Metro Manila and other areas across the country.

item.title: ‘Filipino’ added as ethnicity choice in US census
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: For the first time in the history of the United States census, “Filipino” is included as a choice on questions pertaining to a respondent’s ethnicity.

item.title: More than 6,000 returning Pinoys COVID-19 positive
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Almost 300,000 Filipinos have returned from abroad and over 6,000 of them tested positive for the coronavirus disease 2019, according to the Department of Health.

item.title: Filipino in Australia asks Duterte help recovering ‘kidnapped’ kids
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: A Filipino living in Australia is appealing to President Duterte and Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. to help him regain custody of his two children, who he alleges were kidnapped by social workers from the New South Wales Department of Communities and Justice.

item.title: US: Reconsider deals with Chinese firms
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The United States has urged governments, parties and institutions around the world to assess the risk and reconsider business deals with “predatory” Chinese state-owned enterprises.

item.title: Will quarantine be eased? Duterte decides today
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte is scheduled to announce today the updated quarantine classifications of Metro Manila and other areas. He will also attend a Jordan-led virtual conference later this week.

item.title: National ID pre-registration eyed in October
item.author: Czeriza Valencia
item.description: The Philippine Statistics Authority may start the pre-registration process for the National ID System in October in preparation for mass registration, according to acting Socioeconomic Planning Secretary Karl Chua.

item.title: ‘Digitize PhilHealth data to curb fraud’
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: There is an urgent need to digitize the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. database and upgrade its information technology system to reduce fraud and improve efficiency, Sen. Sonny Angara said yesterday.

item.title: CBCP: Medical workers new heroes
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: The battle against the coronavirus disease 2019 highlighted the heroism of the country’s medical frontliners, an official of the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of the Philippines said yesterday.
